block.p: NEW ENGLAND BUSINESS SERVICE INC., Groton, Mass., a provider of business forms, agreed to buy PremiumWear Inc., Minnetonka, Minn. for $13.50 a share, or about $38 million. It will also assume $2.2 million in PremiumWear debt.
NOVA CHEMICALS CORP., Calgary, Alberta, a petrochemical producer sold its remaining stock in Dynegy Inc., Houston, for $45.8 million, completing its divestiture of the energy services company.

NEW ENGLAND BUSINESS SERVICE INC., Groton, Mass., a provider of business forms, agreed to buy PremiumWear Inc., Minnetonka, Minn. for $13.50 a share, or about $38 million. It will also assume $2.2 million in PremiumWear debt.
NOVA CHEMICALS CORP., Calgary, Alberta, a petrochemical producer sold its remaining stock in Dynegy Inc., Houston, for $45.8 million, completing its divestiture of the energy services company.

KIMBERLY-CLARK CORP., Dallas, the maker of Huggies diapers and Kleenex tissues, agreed to buy S-K Corp., a privately held Taiwanese company that makes and distributes Kimberly-Clark products in Taiwan. The terms were not disclosed.
STANLEY WORKS, New Britain, Conn., the tool company, will buy back up to 10 million of its shares.
